Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: ......Jiji something's wrong with me. After finally making a friend I suddenly became spiteful. It seemed like the quiet and cheerful Kiki disappeared...(Jiji walks off)...? How cold hearted...

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Jiji no matter how nice a friend you've met I wish you'd be on time for dinner. I can never finish cleaning up.

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: Meow...

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: What's with you talking like a cat?

Speaker: JIJI
Dialogue: Meow...

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: ...Jiji what happened to your voice? Say 'Kiki' Jiji! Jiji! I wonder what happened? It seems that I can't understand Jiji...Oh no!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: My magic has gotten weak.

Speaker: OSONO
Dialogue: You can't fly? Because your magic has disappeared?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: It's gotten very weak. I'll have to cancel my delivery service. But then I'll help full-time at the shop. Please let me stay in that room.

Speaker: OSONO
Dialogue: Well that's no problem. Your magic powers will return won't they?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I don't know though I can make another broom.

Speaker: BAKER
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: TOMBO
Dialogue: Kiki? It's Tombo. Did you see me waving from the dirigible today? The captain let us go on a test flight. It was fantastic! Hello hello? Are you listening Kiki?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Don't call me anymore.

Speaker: TOMBO
Dialogue: Huh? What? I can't hear you. The captain wants to meet you. ...? Hello Hello?!

Speaker: OSONO
Dialogue: What's the matter Kiki? You're as white as a sheet.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I'm still in my training period. If my magic disappears there's nothing else I know how to do.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Kiki! Hi! Hey you didn't come to visit me at all so I came myself.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Well that's not true. I'm on a shopping trip so I stopped in.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Come on in. I'm between chores.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Of course. That's what I planned to do.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: This is a pretty nice room.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Have some if you like. I'll make some tea.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: No tea for me. Could I have milk if you have some?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Aha it's true! Exactly like that stuffed cat! You're Jiji aren't you? How's the business? Are you on the right track? It's not going well?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I'm taking a little time off.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Oh?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: On the street I thought you looked a little down-hearted. So that sort of thing happens to witches too? Look why don't you come and stay at my cabin?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Excuse yourself with the shop-lady. One day won't hurt. Jiji won't you come too? Rather be with her huh? OK decide. Let's go right away.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: It's here!

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Made it.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: How beautiful...!

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: What gives? Doesn't this beautiful girl catch anyone's eye?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: What?! You thought I was a boy??

Speaker: DRIVER
Dialogue: Well you looked like one.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: And you didn't notice these beautiful legs?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: The crows...

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: We've become good friends. Ya-hoo I'm home!

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Good day. Please forgive me about last time.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Go on in. I'll get some water.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Well?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: It's wonderful...

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: When I met you I got the inspiration to paint this picture. But you know I can't get this girl's face just right. I've been waiting for you to come.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Is this me?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Well I guess. Sit there a minute. Will you be my model?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: But I'm not that beautiful.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: You have a fine face. It's a lot nicer now than before. Now sit there. That chair is okay. Raise your head a little like you're looking off into the distance. That's it; hold it.

Speaker: Magic
Dialogue: and painting are a lot alike. You know a lot of times I just can't paint.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Really? When that happens what do you do?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: No no. Don't look over here.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Before I could fly without giving it a thought. But now I don't know how I did it.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: When that happens all one can do is struggle through it. I draw and draw and keep drawing.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: But then if I can't fly...

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Then I stop drawing. I take walks look at the scenery take naps do nothing. Then after a while all of a sudden I get the urge to draw again.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I wonder if that will happen?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: It will. Hey look to the side.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: I decided to become an artist when I was about your age. I liked to draw so much I almost hated to go to bed. And then one day all of a sudden I couldn't draw anything. Everything I drew I didn't like.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Hm...

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: I realized that my art up to then was a copy of someone else things I had seen somewhere. I decided I had to discover my own style.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Was it difficult?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: It's still difficult. But then the results...They seem to be a little better than before.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Then witches don't go around casting spells?

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: No they say it's just something passed on to offspring.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: It's nice to be a witch isn't it? I like the idea-- to be a witch to be an artist to be a baker...It's an energy bestowed by the gods or someone right? Though thanks to it we do have to suffer at times...

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: I never even thought about my magic powers. I used to think this training was just an old-fashioned custom...I was so happy you came today. If I were alone I'd just be running around in circles.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: You know to tell you the truth I thought about destroying this painting many times.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Even though it's so beautiful?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: When I met you today and saw your distressed face I thought 'That's it' and I was inspired.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Tease!

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Now we're even.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: OK I'm going to turn it off.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Um. I'm sorry I'm taking your bed.

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: That's OK.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Is it all right if I come and visit some time?

Speaker: URSULA
Dialogue: Sure. I'm here during the summer. And I'll go and visit you sometime too.

Speaker: KIKI
Dialogue: Right.
